subject: Re: [junit] Class Not Found "AllTests"
msgSnippet: Fergus, Thanks for your help.  A fresh day with a new set of eyes saw the errors I was committing yesterday. Everything is running just fine now. Thanks, Karl
messageBody:
Fergus,

Thanks for your help. A fresh day with a new set of
eyes saw the errors I was committing yesterday.
Everything is running just fine now.

Thanks,
Karl


--- Fergus Gallagher <Fergus.Gallagher@...>
wrote:
> But one typically gets a more explicit message in
> this case.
>
>
> On Mon, Jun 10, 2002 at 10:30:50PM +0100, Manuel
> Amago wrote:
> > > Does your CLASSPATH include that directory? You
> can be in the
> > > directory all
> > > you want, but if your CLASSPATH can't see it,
> you might as well be on
> > > Pluto. :)
> >
> > Plus, if AllTests is in a package, you don't need
> to be, in fact, you
> > don't WANT to be, at the directory it is at. You
> want to be at the root
> > of the package hierarchy.
> >
> > Manuel Amago.
> > mailto:mamago@...
> >
> >
